_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Consumers Oil Company feels it is managing the risk of an ahydrous ammonis release through plant inspections and adherance to Missouri Department of Agriculture rules and regulations. It also has training sessions for all employees engaged in the transfer of product and the repair of this facility.



1. Facility Policy.  The owners, management and employees of Consumers Oil Company are committed to theprevention of any accodental releases of Anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, thefacility is prepared to work with the local fire department, the Nodaway County LEPC and /or other authorities to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the public and the environment.

2.  Facility Information.  The primary activity at the facility is the storage of fertilizer for sale to farmers.Anhydrous ammonia is the chemical covered by the risk management program.  It is received, stored anddistributed to the farmers, who are the end users. This RMP covers the storage of nurse tanks at our elevator location south of the office.  Nurse tanks are stored in the open field south of the grain bins during the fall and spring ammonia season. Off season, nurse tanks are stored at the ammonia bulk plant north of the office.



3.  Accidental release prevention program.  The facility has implemented the provisions of "SafetyRequirments for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia and the standards of the U.S.Occupational Safety and Health Administration.

4.  Five Year accident history.  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past fiveyears that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility, nor to ourknowledge, have resulted in any off site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage orenvironmental damage.

5.  Emergency Response Program.  We do not plan to have our employees respond to the release ofanhydrous ammonia.  We have an emergency plan and in case of a rele

ase we will notify the LEPC and thelocal fire department.

6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety.  Safety improvement is an on- going process at the facility.  Weconduct monthly safety meetings and safety equipment checks.  There are no additional specific anhydroussafety recommendations at this time
